TopicTitle: Mod or CFG for ISS continual science (send resources/ return or transmit science)?

Articles.Content:
I am tryiong, for the ISS Community Mod by BobCat and Dragon01, to build more function int othe modules for ISS. I am already researching and working on TAC configs and CLS support, but also I would like to make them scientifically useful also. Because ISS is very much 'in-situ' in low orbit and doesn't move around the planets and moons, the default experiment model doesn't work very well because ISS will quickly become used up once you have fired the experiments on each module a few times for the biomes it passes over.

I am trying to find if the following can be done either with a mod or a CFG file entry:

  1. Make Science continually available for an experiment setup (an ISS module's lab rack for e.g.)
  2. Send Experiment resources up and be able to use it to generate valuable science data
  3. Transmit (via antenna) or return (via Dragon or other crew craft) the science data - obviously already present in-game
  4. Optionally Be able to swap experiments in a rack (so take an experiment up, run it, and return the data then throw it away) - this might fit better with how the game works?

All this will be very notional, I guess, you won't see anything past the movements with CrewManifest and right clicking and processing with the menus but at least it will make modules useful. I would make it not overpowered to prevent it being used as a science spam exploit. Having to fly supplies up to get science is one way, also because ISS only does small experiments and such the base value of the experiments will be relatively low. Given ISS nodes will likely unlock in the tech tree (I would say under Specialized Control or Advanced MetalWorks? They don't have any tree nodes assigned yet) they can still produce good amounts of science (maybe 25-50 per experniment?) and not overpower the system.

I already am thinking of using KAS to fly up, operate, and return external experiments (something to use Dragon's unpressurised trunk for! ) and will work on that too but that is another issue.
